title: Landscape

thumbnail.alt_text: Painting of town and bay filled with ships composed of geometric shapes.

inscriptions: Signed l.r.: A. de S. Cardoso/1912
publication_history:
International Exhibition of Modern Art, exh. cat. (Association of American Painters and Sculptors, Inc., 1913), n.p., cat. 468 (as Paysage).

International Exhibition of Modern Art, 2nd ed., exh. cat. (Association of American Painters and Sculptors, Inc., 1913), n.p., cat. 387.

Arthur Jerome Eddy, Cubists and Post-Impressionists (A. C. McClurg, 1914), p. 85.

Exhibition of Paintings from the Collection of the Late Arthur Jerome Eddy, exh. cat. (Art Institute of Chicago, 1922), p. 6, cat. 16 (color ill., as Marine Pont L’Abbé).

Exhibition of the Arthur Jerome Eddy Collection of Modern Paintings and Sculpture, Part II of the Bulletin of the Art Institute of Chicago, XXV, no. 9 (Dec. 1931): p. 24, cat. 16.

The Art Institute of Chicago: A Guide to the Paintings in the Permanent Collection (Art Institute of Chicago, 1932), p. 172 (as Marine: Pont L’Abbé).

C. J. Bulliet, “The Eddy Gift to Chicago,” Creative Art 10 (March 1932), p. 216.

José-Augusto França, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso (Editorial Sul, 1956), pp. 61; 63, cat. 8; n.p. (ill.).

Paintings in The Art Institute of Chicago: A Catalogue of the Picture Collection (Art Institute of Chicago, 1961), p. 421 (as Marine: Pont L’Abbé).

Milton W. Brown, The Story of the Armory Show (New York Graphic Society, 1963), pp. 100; 292, cat. 468 (as Paysage).

1913 Armory Show—50th Anniversary Exhibition 1963, exh. cat. (Munson-Williams-Proctor Institute, 1963), pp. 81; 205, cat. 468; n.p. (color ill.).

José-Augusto França, Amadeo de Souza-Cardoso (Inquérito, 1972), p. 22, fig. 8 (ill.).

Paulo Ferreira, “Amadeo de Souza-Cardoso: le météore portugais,” L’oeil: revue d’art mensuelle 244 (Nov. 1975), p. 33.

Paris—New York, exh. cat. (Centre national d’art et de culture Georges Pompidou, 1977), p. 719 (as Paysage).

A. James Speyer and Courtney Graham Donnell, Twentieth-Century European Paintings (University of Chicago Press, 1980), p. 71, no. 4A3 (microfiche ill., as Marine: Pont L’abbé, 1909).

Amadeo de Souza-Cardoso: A Primeira Descoberta de Portugal: Na Europa no Século XX, exh. cat. (Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, 1983), n.p. (ill. as Marine: Pont L’Abbé).

Constance H. Schwartz, The Shock of Modernism: Modernism in America, exh. cat. (Nassau County Museum of Fine Art, 1984), p. 84, cat. 143 (color ill.).

António Quadros Ferreira, “Amadeo de Souza-Cardoso – Descoberta de Portugal,” Jornal de Noticias, Apr. 18, 1985.

José-Augusto França, Amadeo de Souza-Cardoso: o português à força & Alameda Negreiros: o português sem mestre (Bertrand, 1986), pp. 34 (ill.); 35.

Paul Kruty, “Arthur Jerome Eddy and his Collection: Prelude and Postscript to the Armory Show,” Arts Magazine 61, no. 6 (February 1987): pp. 43; 46n34.

José-Augusto França, “Amadeo de 1955 a 1987,” Colóquio artes: revista trimestral de artes visuais, música e bailado 73, 2nd series, 29th year (Jun. 1987), p. 7 (ill.).

1887–1987, Centenário do Nascimento de Amedeo de Souza Cardoso, exh. cat. (Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, 1987), pp. 128–129 (color ill.).

Milton W. Brown, The story of the Armory Show (Abbeville Press, 1988), p. 317.

Amadeo de Souza Cardoso, 1887-1918 (Europália, 1991), p. 95, cat. 23 (color ill.).

Amadeo de Souza Cardoso, 1887-1918 (Fundação de Serralves, 1992), p. 95, cat. 23 (color ill.).

Paulo Ferreira, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso: Peintre Portugais 1887–1918 (Centre Culturel Calouste Gulkenkian, 1995), pp. 99, 133.

Laurette E. McCarthy, “Walter Pach: Artist, Critic, Historian, and Agent of Modernism,” Ph.D. dissertation, University of Delaware, 1996, pp. 114; 126n58.

Amadeo de Souza Cardoso, exh. cat. (Fundación Juan March, 1998), p. 79.

At the Edge: A Portuguese Futurist, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso, exh. cat. (Corcoran Gallery of Art, 1999), pp. 32; 83; 88–89; 91; 92; 124 (color ill.); 191, cat. 9.

Museu de Arte Contemporânea de Serralves, Mondrian/Amadeo: da paisagem à abstracção/from landscape to abstraction, exh. cat. (Museu de Arte Contemporânea de Serralves, 2001), p. 103.

Cinco Pintores da Modernidade Portuguesa: 1911–1965, exh. cat. (Fundació Caixa Catalunya, 2004), p. 87, cat. 2 (color ill.).

Amadeo de Souza Cardoso: Diálogo de Vanguardas/Avant-Garde Dialogues (Centro de Arte Moderna José de Azeredo Perdigão, Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, 2006), pp. 15; 16; 35; 36; 41; 42; 341, cat. 6; 369; 370; 404; 407; 459; 462; n.p. (color ill.).

Helena de Freitas, ed., Catálogo Raisonné: Amadeo de Souza Cardoso (Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian; Assírio & Alvim, 2008), pp. 167-170, cat. P31 (color ill.).

Helena de Freitas, ed., Catálogo Raisonné: Amadeo de Souza Cardoso, 2nd ed. (Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, 2016), pp. 167-170, cat. P31 (color ill.).
exhibition_history:
New York, International Exhibition of Modern Art, Feb. 17–Mar. 15, 1913, cat. 468, as Paysage; Art Institute of Chicago, Mar. 24–Apr. 16, 1913, cat. 387.

Art Institute of Chicago, Exhibition of Paintings from the Collection of the Late Arthur Jerome Eddy, Sept.19–Oct. 22, 1922, cat. 16 (as Marine).

Art Institute of Chicago, Exhibition of the Arthur Jerome Eddy Collection of Modern Paintings and Sculpture, Dec. 22, 1931–Jan. 17, 1932, cat. 16 (as Marine: Pont L’Abbé).

Utica, Munson-Williams-Proctor Institute, 1913 Armory Show—50th Anniversary Exhibition 1963, Feb. 17–Mar. 31, 1963, cat. 468 (as Paysage), 1912; New York, Armory of the 69th Regiment, Apr. 6–28, 1963.

Roslyn, N. Y., Nassau County Museum of Fine Art, The Shock of Modernism: Modernism in America, Apr. 29–July 29, 1984, cat. 143 (as Marine: Pont L’Abbé).

Lisbon, Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, 1887–1987, Centenário do Nascimento de Amedoe de Souza Cardoso, July 20–Oct. 1987 (as Marine Pont L’Abbé).

Brussels, Museum of Modern Art, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso, 1887-1918, Sept. 27–Dec. 8, 1991, cat. 23; Porto, Fundação de Serralves, Mar. 5–Apr. 19, 1992.

Washington D. C., Corcoran Gallery of Art, At the Edge: A Portuguese Futurist, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso, Sept. 11–Nov. 28, 1999, cat. 9 (as Marine pont l’Abbé); Arts Club of Chicago, Jan. 20–Mar. 17, 2000.

Porto, Museu de Arte Contemporânea de Serralves, Mondrian/Amadeo: da paisagem à abstracção/from landscape to abstraction, June 28–Oct. 14, 2001.

Barcelona, Fundació Caixa Catalunya, Cinco Pintores da Modernidade Portuguesa, (1911–1965), Feb. 17–May 16, 2004, cat. 2 (as Marine Pont l’Abbé); Museu de Arte Moderna de São Paulo, June 24–Sept. 12, 2004.

Lisbon, Centro de Arte Moderna José de Azeredo Perdigão, Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso: Diálogo de Vanguardas/Avant-Garde Dialogues, Nov. 15, 2006–Jan. 14, 2007, cat. 6.

Paris, Galeries nationales d'exposition du Grand Palais, Paris, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso, Apr. 20–July 18, 2016.
provenance_text: The artist; sold through Walter Pach, New York, to Arthur Jerome Eddy (1859-1920), Chicago, Apr. 10, 1913 [letter to the artist, May 2, 1913, Walter Kuhn papers, Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution, copy in curatorial object file; McCarthy 1996; Washington 1999]; by descent to his wife Lucy O. Eddy (1863-1931) and son Jerome O. Eddy (1891-1951), Chicago, 1920; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1931.
